comments:
CDT 200406180301

The 137 errors (failing 137 junits tests) are because of this one exception:

org/eclipse/ui/wizards/datatransfer/IImportStructureProvider 

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
org/eclipse/ui/wizards/datatransfer/IImportStructureProvider
at org.eclipse.cdt.core.indexer.tests.IndexManagerTests.createProject(Unknown 
Source)
at org.eclipse.cdt.core.indexer.tests.IndexManagerTests.setUp(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:320)
at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:199)
at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:35)
at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.run(CoreTestApplication.java:31)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run
(PlatformActivator.java:335)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:272)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:128)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:186)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:647)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:631)
This was first introduced in build 200406140300.

I loaded up the eclipse build I20040618 and took the latest CDT from head.   
The class IImportStructureProvider exists in eclipse, and the CDT JUnits run 
successfully  100% pass rate.

I will forward this one to Doug, to see if there is something broken in the 
build environment that he uses.  I will bump this to P1 until we can figure out 
what is wrong.

Interesting that these errors started with the new RC3 integration builds...

At any rate, the problem is with the test environment, not the build. I 
installed the build and ran the tests and they were fine.

For now, we may want to do this as part of the sanity instead of the build. 
It's easy. Here's how:

1) Create a new install with Eclipse and the CDT unzipped.
2) Launch creating a new workspace.
3) Download org.eclipse.cdt.core.tests from CVS. You may want to use a Date Tag 
to select a snapshot of the tests at the time of the build.
4) Launch a new JUnit Plugin Test selecting the class AutomatedIntegrationSuite 
out of the core.tests plugin. Watch the action...

You can run other tests this way as well, e.g. UI tests.

Dropping to P2.

This will not gate 2.0.1,  it is a test environment problem that does not occur 
anywhere else.  I have moved it to 2.1.

The test framework needs to be rewritten. Bug 70211 should address this.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 70211 ***
